net.jawr.web.resource.handler.bundle

Class AbstractResourceBundleHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jawr.web.resource.handler.bundle.AbstractResourceBundleHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceBundleHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServletContextResourceBundleHandler

    public abstract class AbstractResourceBundleHandler
extends Object
implements ResourceBundleHandler
    This class defines the abstract class for the resource bundle handler
    Author:
    Jordi Hernández Sellés, Ibrahim Chaehoi

      The charset to use for the files

      • AbstractResourceBundleHandler

        protected AbstractResourceBundleHandler(File tempDirRoot,
                             Charset charset,
                             GeneratorRegistry generatorRegistry,
                             String resourceType)
        Build a resource handler based on the specified temporary files root path and charset.
        Parameters:
        tempDirRoot - Root dir for storing bundle files.
        charset - Charset to read/write characters.
        generatorRegistry - the generator registry
        resourceType - the resource type

      • AbstractResourceBundleHandler

        protected AbstractResourceBundleHandler(String tempDirRoot,
                             Charset charset,
                             String resourceType,
                             boolean createTempSubDir)
        Build a resource handler based on the specified temporary files root path and charset.
        Parameters:
        tempDirRoot - Root dir for storing bundle files.
        charset - Charset to read/write characters.
        resourceType - the resource type
        createTempSubDir - the flag indicating if we should use the jawrTemp sub directory

      • AbstractResourceBundleHandler

                             boolean createTempSubDir)

        Parameters:
        tempDirRoot - Root dir for storing bundle files.
        charset - Charset to read/write characters.
        resourceType - the resource type
        createTempSubDir - the flag indicating if we should use the jawrTemp sub directory

        Parameters:
